titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Maurice Shapiro Environmental Health Collection, 1919-2001 UA.90.F65
titlestmt.author: Ashley Taylor.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:58:54 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Maurice A. Shapiro Environmental Health Collection

physdesc.extent: (41 record center boxes, 2 card file boxes)

did.abstract: The Maurice A. Shapiro Environmental Health Collections documents the career and research interests of Maurice A. Shapiro, longtime professor at the University of Pittsburgh's Graduate School of Public Health (GSPH). Shapiro was a noted sanitary engineer and advocate of environmental health whose research interests included air and water pollution, lead poisoning, sewage treatment, and food and housing sanitation. He was also known for his involvement in large national and international projects, several of which are documented here. Also included is material related to his career at the University, including administrative and course material. This collections includes correspondence, reports, publications, pamphlets, notes, papers, and a small amount of audio and visual material.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Maurice A. Shapiro on October 28, 1999.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Ashley L. Taylor in the fall of 2013.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Maurice A. Shapiro Environmental Health Collection, 1919-2001, UA.90.F65, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Maurice A. Shapiro Environmental Health Collection, 1919-2001, UA.90.F65, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The material in this collection primarily documents Shapiro's research interests, along with his involvement with various environmental health projects and studies. This includes material related to his involvement with the Westernport Bay Environmental Study (based in Victoria, Australia), the Ohio River Basin Energy Study, projects in Israel, the Lake Chad Basin Energy Study (surveying the African countries of Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Niger, and Nigeria) and various other projects. Also included is a large amount of material related to his areas of research in environmental health, including air and water quality, lead poisoning, sewage treatment, and food and housing sanitation. The collection also includes material related to his career as a professor at the University of Pittsburgh, including information on committees he served on, the Graduate School of Public Health's accreditation process, course material, papers from students, and many of Shapiro's own publications and project summaries. The collection includes papers, notes, correspondence, pamphlets, conference proceedings, publications, reports, and a small amount audio recordings and slides.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Maurice Ansel Shapiro, called Moshe by those who knew him, was a Professor of Sanitary Engineering, Environmental Health Engineering, and Urban Affairs at the University of Pittsburgh. Born on June 4, 1917 in Denver, Colorado, Shapiro spent much of his childhood in Palestine. His father was employed as a public health physician, and his mother as a social worker. He returned to the United States for college, receiving his undergraduate degree in Biology from Johns Hopkins University in 1941, and his graduate degree in Sanitary Engineering from the University of California at Berkeley in 1949. In between receiving his two degrees, he served as a member of the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration during World War II as part of the United States Public Health Service. It was then that he met and married his wife, Anne.

After receiving his graduate degree, Shapiro relocated to Pittsburgh to join the newly-opened Graduate School of Public Health (GSPH) in 1951 as Assistant Professor of Sanitary Engineering. He was promoted to Associate Professor in 1958, and finally to Professor of Environmental Health Engineering in 1965. In tandem with his 1965 appointment in GSPH, he became Professor of Urban Affairs at Pitt's Graduate School of Public and International Affairs (GSPIA). He retained both positions until his retirement in 1982, after which he became Professor Emeritus.

Outside of his academic achievements, Shapiro was passionate about environmental and public health, and was heavily involved in numerous projects and organizations that promoted environmental sanitation. He was a Core Team Member of the Ohio River Basin Energy Study in the 1970s, a consultant for a World Health Organization (WHO) and United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) planning project in Lagos, Nigeria, involved with numerous projects in Israel, among others. One of the projects that he was most proud of was the Western Port Bay Environmental Study in Victoria, Australia. While on sabbatical in 1973 and 1974, Shapiro served as foundation director for the study, which was aimed at protecting the region's ecology.

Shapiro was fondly remembered as a passionate professor and a devoted family member. He was a father of five. His wife, Anne, died in September 2010; he passed away shortly after on November 10, 2010, in Portland, Oregon.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Maurice A. Shapiro Environmental Health Collection is arranged into six series and numerous subseries. Information about each can be found at the series level.
Series V. University of Pittsburgh Files
Series VI. Audio and Visual Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Correspondence Series includes assorted correspondence kept by Shapiro over the course of his career. Much of the material was arranged chronologically, though some specific topics or correspondence with certain individuals were kept separate. The series is arranged first chronologically, and then alphabetically by subject. It dates from 1960 to 2001.

did.unittitle: University Environmental Health and Safety Unit

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Projects Series is comprised of information on certain projects that Shapiro lead or was involved in. The series contains six subseries on Israel; Lake Chad Basin Energy Study; Ohio River Basin Energy Study; Ohio River Valley Water Sanitation Commission; Smaller Projects; and Westernport Bay Environmental Study. Geographically, these projects involve the countries of Australia, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, China, Israel, Niger, Nigeria, Russia, St. Lucia, and the United States of America (the states of of Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee and West Virginia).The material in this series dates from 1933 to 2000, is arranged alphabetically, and includes notes, publications, reports, research data, and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Public Health Series contains information on files that Shapiro kept that were directly related to public health concerns, primarily in Allegheny County. The series contains six subseries: Allegheny County Health Department; American Public Health Association; Conferences and Meetings; General; Illness and Disease; and Occupational Health. This series dates from 1948 to 2001, is arranged alphabetically, and contains publications, notes, reports, research data, and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Research Files Series contains material on research topics that Shapiro was interested in. For the majority of these files, Shapiro kept a numbered and organized list that broke down his interests by topic. These areas of interests became the subseries reflected in this arrangement. There are 12 subseries: Air; Animal Vector Diseases; Energy; Environmental Hygiene; Food Sanitation; General; Lead; Public Health Administration; Sanitation; Sewage; Waste; and Water. Each subseries is arranged first by the numbered system that Shapiro had assigned in his own office, then is arranged alphabetically by accompanying related material that he had not assigned a number to. The material in this series dates from 1919 to 2000, and includes reports, publications, correspondence, research data, and notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The University of Pittsburgh Files Series contains material related to Shapiro's career as a professor at the University of Pittsburgh. The series contains four subseries: Administrative Material; Course Material; Presentations and Publications; and Student Papers. The material in this series dates from 1946 to 1999, though the bulk of the material is from his tenure as professor between 1951 and 1982. The series is arranged alphabetically, and includes papers, correspondence, reports, memos, publications, the text of presentations, and syllabi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Audio and Visual Materials Series contains primarily audio cassette recordings of conference proceedings from an unidentified March 1979 environmental sanitation conference. Also included is an audio recording of a Water Workshop in 1985, and slides on assorted topics and Municipal Sewage Treatment. The collection includes material from 1979 and 1985, and the slides are undated.

did.unittitle: Slide box, Municipal Sewage Treatment slides
